db:abstract.db:para: Provides locale specific properties and formatted data.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The Locale object may only be created via the Qt.locale() function. It cannot be created directly.
The Qt.locale() function returns a JS Locale object representing the locale with the specified name, which has the format "language[_territory][.codeset][@modifier]" or "C".

Locale supports the concept of a default locale, which is determined from the system's locale settings at application startup. If no parameter is passed to Qt.locale() the default locale object is returned.
The Locale object provides a number of functions and properties providing data for the specified locale.
The Locale object may also be passed to the Date and Number toLocaleString() and fromLocaleString() methods in order to convert to/from strings using the specified locale.

db:section.db:title: Locale String Format Types
db:section.db:para: The monthName(), standaloneMonthName(), dayName() and standaloneDayName() can use the following enumeration values to specify the formatting of the string representation for a Date object.

db:td.db:para: The long version of day and month names; for example, returning "January" as a month name.
The short version of day and month names; for example, returning "Jan" as a month name.

A special version of day and month names for use when space is limited; for example, returning "J" as a month name. Note that the narrow format might contain the same text for different months and days or it can even be an empty string if the locale doesn't support narrow names, so you should avoid using it for date formatting. Also, for the system locale this format is the same as ShortFormat.

db:section.db:title: amText : string
db:section.db:para: The localized name of the "AM" suffix for times specified using the conventions of the 12-hour clock.

db:section.db:title: decimalPoint : string
db:section.db:para: Holds the decimal point character of this locale.

db:section.db:title: exponential : string
db:section.db:para: Holds the exponential character of this locale.

db:section.db:title: firstDayOfWeek : enumeration
db:section.db:para: Holds the first day of the week according to the current locale.

db:note.db:para: that these values match the JS Date API which is different from the Qt C++ API where Qt::Sunday = 7.

db:section.db:title: groupSeparator : string
db:section.db:para: Holds the group separator character of this locale.

db:section.db:title: measurementSystem : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property defines which units are used for measurement.

db:td.db:para: This value indicates metric units, such as meters, centimeters and millimeters.
This value indicates imperial units, such as inches and miles as they are used in the United States.
This value indicates imperial units, such as inches and miles as they are used in the United Kingdom.
Provided for compatibility. The same as Locale.ImperialUSSystem.

db:section.db:title: name : string
db:section.db:para: Holds the language and territory of this locale as a string of the form "language_territory", where language is a lowercase, two-letter ISO 639 language code, and territory is an uppercase, two- or three-letter ISO 3166 territory code.

db:section.db:title: nativeLanguageName : string
db:section.db:para: Holds a native name of the language for the locale. For example "Schwiizert端端tsch" for Swiss-German locale.

db:section.db:title: nativeTerritoryName : string
db:section.db:para: Holds a native name of the territory for the locale. For example "Espa単a" for Spanish/Spain locale.

db:section.db:title: negativeSign : string
db:section.db:para: Holds the negative sign character of this locale.

db:section.db:title: numberOptions : enumeration
db:section.db:para: Holds a set of options for number-to-string and string-to-number conversions.

db:section.db:title: percent : string
db:section.db:para: Holds the percent character of this locale.

db:section.db:title: pmText : string
db:section.db:para: The localized name of the "PM" suffix for times specified using the conventions of the 12-hour clock.

db:section.db:title: positiveSign : string
db:section.db:para: Holds the positive sign character of this locale.

db:section.db:title: textDirection : enumeration
db:section.db:para: Holds the text direction of the language:

db:td.db:para: Text normally begins at the left side.
Text normally begins at the right side.

db:section.db:title: uiLanguages : Array<string>
db:section.db:para: Returns an ordered list of locale names for translation purposes in preference order.
The return value represents locale names that the user expects to see the UI translation in.
The first item in the list is the most preferred one.

db:section.db:title: weekDays : Array<int>
db:section.db:para: Holds an array of days that are considered week days according to the current locale, where Sunday is 0 and Saturday is 6.

db:section.db:title: zeroDigit : string
db:section.db:para: Holds Returns the zero digit character of this locale.

db:section.db:title: string currencySymbol(format)
db:section.db:para: Returns the currency symbol for the specified format:

db:td.db:para: a ISO-4217 code of the currency.
a user readable name of the currency.

db:section.db:title: string dateFormat(type)
db:section.db:para: Returns the date format used for the current locale. type specifies the FormatType to return.

db:section.db:title: string dateTimeFormat(type)
db:section.db:para: Returns the date time format used for the current locale. type specifies the FormatType to return.

db:section.db:title: string dayName(day, type)
db:section.db:para: Returns the localized name of the day (where 0 represents Sunday, 1 represents Monday and so on), in the optional FormatType specified by type.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.2] string formattedDataSize(int bytes, int precision, DataSizeFormat format)
db:section.db:para: Converts a size in bytes to a human-readable localized string, comprising a number and a quantified unit.
The precision and format arguments are optional.
For more information, see QLocale::formattedDataSize().
This method was introduced in Qt 6.2.

db:section.db:title: string monthName(month, type)
db:section.db:para: Returns the localized name of month (0-11), in the optional FormatType specified by type.

db:note.db:para: the QLocale C++ API expects a range of (1-12), however Locale.monthName() expects 0-11 as per the JS Date object.

db:section.db:title: string standaloneDayName(day, type)
db:section.db:para: Returns the localized name of the day (where 0 represents Sunday, 1 represents Monday and so on) that is used as a standalone text, in the FormatType specified by type.
If the locale information does not specify the standalone day name then return value is the same as in dayName().

db:section.db:title: string standaloneMonthName(month, type)
db:section.db:para: Returns the localized name of month (0-11) that is used as a standalone text, in the optional FormatType specified by type.
If the locale information doesn't specify the standalone month name then return value is the same as in monthName().

db:note.db:para: the QLocale C++ API expects a range of (1-12), however Locale.standaloneMonthName() expects 0-11 as per the JS Date object.

db:section.db:title: string timeFormat(type)
db:section.db:para: Returns the time format used for the current locale. type specifies the FormatType to return.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.5] string toString(int i)
db:section.db:para: Returns a localized string representation of i.
This method was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.5] string toString(double f, char format = 'g', int precision = 6)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a string representing the floating-point number f.
The form of the representation is controlled by the optional format and precision parameters.
See QLocale::toString(double, char, int) for more information.
This method was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.5] string toString(Date date, string format)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a localized string representation of the given date in the specified format. If format is an empty string, an empty string is returned.
This method was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.5] string toString(Date date, FormatType format = LongFormat)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a localized string representation of the given date in the specified format. If format is omitted, Locale.LongFormat is used.
This method was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for Locale
db:section.db:para: The following members of QML type Locale are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: nativeCountryName : string
db:section.db:para: This property is deprecated since 6.4. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use nativeTerritoryName instead.
Holds a native name of the country for the locale. For example "Espa単a" for Spanish/Spain locale.
